name: Exponent Rules
latex: a^m \times a^n = a^{m+n}, \quad \frac{a^m}{a^n} = a^{m-n}, \quad (a^m)^n = a^{mn}, \quad a^0 = 1
explanation: Exponents represent repeated multiplication. When multiplying powers with the same base, add the exponents. When dividing, subtract the exponents. When raising a power to a power, multiply the exponents. Any number (except 0) raised to the 0 power equals 1. These rules simplify working with exponential expressions.
